text:
Robotics will be als major 2026 theme since becoming the physical expression of the AI economy.

The companies that own data, distribution, simulation & real-world deployment will define the next decade of productivity.

Jensen Huang says self-driving will be the first multi-trillion-dollar robotics market.

The companies best positioned:
‚Ä¢ $NVDA fueling robotic intelligence
‚Ä¢ $AMZN automating logistics at scale
‚Ä¢ $ISRG transforming surgery with robotics
‚Ä¢ $TSLA leading with real-world humanoid AI
‚Ä¢ $PLTR orchestrating real-time intelligence for autonomous systems

MY 2026 PREDICTIONS

1. Amazon goes from Mag-7 laggard to leader as AWS reaccelerates.
Compute bottlenecks fade, Trainium gains real adoption & AWS growth moves back toward the mid-twenties, while Ads continues its steady climb & becomes a second profit engine that structurally lifts $AMZN margins.

2. Space industry becomes a mainstream investment theme.
A $1.5T SpaceX IPO forces public markets to rethink what the space economy is actually worth. That shift accelerates as Sam Altman explores a direct SpaceX competitor & as Sundar Pichai, Jeff Bezos & Elon Musk openly discuss orbital compute which creates a rare moment where politics, capital & technology align. $RKLB & $ASTS are my highest-conviction ways to express that re-rating.

3. Emerging markets outperform the S&P 500.
A weaker dollar, lower rates and an explosion of digital products built from AI tools give EM a structural tailwind, with Latin America positioned to benefit the most. $MELI remains my highest-conviction expression of this theme.

4. Model costs collapse again & push value to whoever controls distribution.
As inference becomes cheaper & model performance converges then the models themselves stop being the profit center & the power shifts to platforms that own consumer engagement. $META, $GOOGL & $AAPL outperform because distribution becomes the moat since they control the surfaces where billions interact with AI every day.

5. Productivity boom finally shows up in the data.
The Fed‚Äôs GDP upgrades for 2026‚Äì2027 become visible as AI replaces manual workflows, raises output per worker & compresses cost structures across the economy. The gap between companies that embraced AI early & those that delayed adoption widens meaningfully in earnings.

FAVORITE 10 NAMES UNDER $10B ENTERING 2026

1. $ONDS drone connectivity layer
2. $CIFR landlord of the AI utility era
3. $JMIA scaling logistics across Africa
4. $DOCN AI inference cloud for builders
5. $IREN building compute at industrial scale
6. $CLPT navigation platform for neurosurgeons
7. $EOSE zinc storage built for nonstop compute
8. $NVTS powering AI data centers with GaN chips
9. $VKTX oral/injectable GLP-1s for obesity & diabetes
10. $TMDX expanding organ care with fleet & network effect

2026 SPACE ECONOMY WATCHLIST

A SpaceX IPO in 2026 would put the entire $1.8T space economy under the brightest spotlight it has ever had because once the anchor of the sector goes public every layer of the ecosystem gets pulled into the narrative. 

Here‚Äôs the ecosystem: 
‚Ä¢ Moon Builders | $LUNR
‚Ä¢ Space Metals Foundries | $USAR, $ATI
‚Ä¢ Space Data Miners | $SPIR, $BKSY, $PL
‚Ä¢ Earth-to-Orbit Network | $T, $TMUS, $VZ
‚Ä¢ Space Hardware Guild | $HON, $LHX, $RDW
‚Ä¢ Space Internet Providers | $VSAT, $IRDM, $SATS
‚Ä¢ Eyes & Ears of Orbit | $BWXT, $TDY, $ST, $AME
‚Ä¢ Space Engines | $RKLB, $FLY,  SpaceX, Blue Origin
‚Ä¢ Orbital Real Estate Developers | $ASTS, $PL, $NOC, $BA, Starlink
‚Ä¢ Defense Space Commanders | $NOC, $LMT, $BA, $LHX, $PLTR

Any time a big long-term trend like AI becomes obvious the market will throw pullbacks and scary headlines to force investors into confusing temporary price movement with actual long-term danger.

That is how it transfers wealth from the impatient to the informed.
Here are the key levels to watch for $ORCL on a potential entry that's using Price Action Concepts Indicator from LuxAlgo:

$GOOGL just expanded live speech translation in Google Translate from Pixel Buds to any headphones.

Real-time translations now work across 70+ languages making it a platform-level feature rather than a device-specific one.

$ORCL says there have been no delays across any sites tied to contractual commitments and that all milestones remain on track.

I guess AI bears will have to wait a little longer for that slowdown.

You‚Äôll hear plenty of AI-bear noise this weekend framing the $ORCL data-center delay as demand softening but what‚Äôs really happening is the market shifting into a phase where it wants clean revenue scaling, margin discipline & clearer financing visibility rather than giant RPO headlines.

The AI buildout is shifting from ‚Äúscale at any cost‚Äù to ‚Äúscale with economics attached.

OpenAI recently partnered with Australia‚Äôs NextDC to build a $4.6 billion data center in Sydney, with operations expected to commence in late 2027 and accelerate the company‚Äôs APAC expansion.

$MSFT $ORCL $AMZN $GOOG
Nvidia $NVDA is reportedly considering increasing H200 output to meet strong China demand, shortly after the US granted approval of H200 export licenses to China for a 25% fee.

AI cloud startup Fluidstack is said to be in talks to raise $700 million in funding at a $7 billion valuation, with the company striking deals to develop data centers with TeraWulf $WULF and Cipher Mining $CIFR.

$GOOG $NVDA

Oracle $ORCL has reportedly pushed back completion dates for some of its data centers for OpenAI from 2027 to 2028, largely due to material and labor shortages, per Bloomberg.

Today marks 1 year since the launch of the GraniteShares 2x Long SMCI Daily ETF (NASDAQ: SMCL).

Over the past year, SMCI has offered market participants a way to seek 2x the daily performance of Super Micro Computer Incorporated stock, before fees and expenses, through a transparent, exchange-traded structure.
